intro: Anapausia semipinnatifida var. decurrens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved anapausia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. This species is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
